results.title: As India’s Lethal Covid Wave Neared, Politics Overrode Science
results.abstract: The country’s top science agency tailored its findings to fit Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s optimistic narrative despite a looming crisis, researchers say.

results.title: Iran Nears an Atomic Milestone
results.abstract: Edging close to a bomb’s worth of fuel is seen as a tactic to pressure the Biden administration into agreeing to a quick renewal of the 2015 nuclear deal.
results.byline: By David E. Sanger and William J. Broad

results.title: From shutdown to reopening: Here’s a look at N.Y.C. schools’ trek through the pandemic.
results.abstract: Delays, disappointments, false starts and abrupt reversals marked the 18 months of pandemic disruptions for students, teachers, parents and others in the nation’s largest school system.

results.title: Pentagon Defends Deadly Drone Strike in Kabul
results.abstract: A New York Times investigation, with video analysis and interviews at the site, has cast doubt on the U.S. military’s account.
results.byline: By Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.title: Here’s how in-person teaching is playing out across the U.S.
results.abstract: School reopenings tend to do well in areas with high vaccination rates, but the picture is very different for schools in areas with lower rates.
